title: For Sale:  Winchester Black Talon .357 Magnum
postcontent: This is one box ( less 2 rounds) of Winchester Black Talon .357 Magnum. SXT Deep Penetrator ammunition 20 cartridges to a box. Originally designed and released in 1991 this cartridge was the first to include a pre-scored jacket. It also included a reverse taper design which allowed it's signature talons to be released perpendicular to the bullet upon impact. The black color of the bullet comes from the oxidized copper jacket and the LubaLox coating which was new for Winchester at the time. LubaLox protects the rifling of the barrel as well as provides lubrication for the bullet while traveling the length of the barrel. It is still used on many of their cartridges today minus the black color. In all Black Talon was cutting edge technology for it's time, thee best hollow point on the market. After a few mass shootings Black Talon proved it's effectiveness but in an unfortunately negative light. Without even being on the market for two years Winchester decided it was in the company's best interest to pull the Black Talon line in 1993. However the Black Talon bullet was re-incarnated into brass casings and sold in boxes of 50 to law enforcement only up until 2000 under the name Ranger SXT which stood for (Supreme eXpansion Talon) but the media once again criticized the "Talon" name into nonexistence and it became known as (Supreme eXpansion Technology) a much more "politically correct" term. Although the Black Talon's days seemed over Winchester released a new cartridge in 2009 following the design nearly identically with some modern advancements. This new cartridge which was also part of the Supreme Elite Series, same as the Black Talon is know as PDX1. PDX1 is arguably one of the best cartridges on the market today, so much so, that it is the FBI's ammunition of choice  So what it comes down to is own a piece of Winchester history for $30.00.
